e4: In light of the concerns about legal liability and ensuring fairness to all investors, I recommend changing to the new policy without bias. Communicating the change effectively can help mitigate negative market reactions, and addressing sophisticated hedge funds' advantage over retail investors requires careful strategies separate from this financial reporting issue.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should be unbiased, providing accurate and clear information to investors without deception or manipulation. Considerations relevant in this context include maintaining transparency, ensuring consistency, and following best practices for financial reporting established by regulatory authorities, such as the Securities and Exchange Commission. Balancing the needs of different types of investors is also important. A policy that prioritizes advanced investors over less knowledgeable retail investors would not be viewed as ethical.
e6: No questions at this time, but it would be beneficial to request more information on potential actions being taken to limit any negative impact on small investors should the policy change. Additionally, obtaining clarification on how the company plans to communicate the change in reporting policy in a transparent and effective manner to all investors might be valuable.
